physical_appearance:This is an article from the periodical \u0027The Orient Illustrated Weekly\u0027 published on 14 July 1946. The title is printed at the top-center of the page. There is an excerpt of the article printed in the center.  This article features four photographs of the Indian National Army. The edges of the clipping is slightly torn
 especially at the corners. The two-paged article is bound together by a tape in the center along the spine of the publication.

sgcool_label_text:\Prior to the World War II period
 Indians in Singapore and Malaya retained strong political
 sentimental and economic ties with their home country. Anti-colonial thoughts and actions
 inspired by the \\call for freedom\\ in India

metadata.title_text: The Orient The Story of The Indian Independence Movement in East Asia
metadata.creator_2: Lt. K. E. Kochunni Nair, I. N. A. (?)
metadata.physical_appearance: This is an article from the periodical 'The Orient Illustrated Weekly' published on 14 July 1946. The title is printed at the top-center of the page. There is an excerpt of the article printed in the center.  This article features four photographs of the Indian National Army. The edges of the clipping is slightly torn, especially at the corners. The two-paged article is bound together by a tape in the center along the spine of the publication.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: "Prior to the World War II period, Indians in Singapore and Malaya retained strong political, sentimental and economic ties with their home country. Anti-colonial thoughts and actions, inspired by the ""call for freedom"" in India
